I feel for the person that is getting ripped of and thought they got a deal.<BR><BR><B><I>psfponies <psfponies@...></I></B> wrote:  <BLOCKQUOTE class=replbq style="PADDING-LEFT: 5px; MARGIN-LEFT: 5px; BORDER-LEFT: #1010ff 2px solid">  <DIV id=ygrp-text>  <div>The current bid on the hacked RS 12-469 on ebay is $100.00. <BR><BR>Kay<BR><BR>--- In <A href="mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com">EVP-ITC@yahoogroups<WBR>.com</A>, "itcdeadpeople" <ITCdeadpeople@<WBR>...> <BR>wrote:<BR>><BR>> That's a whole lot of IF's, Michael, but IF all those things were <BR>to come together, it <BR>> certainly would be a quandary as to whether or not approaching a <BR>complete stranger
 <BR>> would be appropriate. One can argue that the person in spirit has <BR>gone to great lengths <BR>> to make contact with their loved one. However.....<WBR>..<BR>> <BR>> On the flip side, just because someone is in spirit, does not mean <BR>that they are <BR>> automatically omniscient, nor that they have the right to impose <BR>their will (or you impose <BR>> your will, for that matter) on a loved one who may not be open to <BR>the communication <BR>> emotionally or spiritually. <BR>> <BR>> Assuming we are (as many indications have it) pretty much the same <BR>person in spirit that <BR>> we were here in the physical (our personalities remain fairly in <BR>tact, though just as here, <BR>> there can be growth and change on the other side), it would not be <BR>out of the realm of <BR>> possibility for them to tell you their loved one is open to <BR>communication, when in fact they <BR>> might not be.<BR>> <BR>> I guess my bottom
 line is this: There are so many people out <BR>there who are open to the <BR>> idea of EVP communication and are seeking to make contact with <BR>their departed loved <BR>> ones, that there is no need for approaching strangers with <BR>messages. The potential for <BR>> harm is just too great, and it is not our place (or the place of <BR>the person in spirit) to make <BR>> these kind of decisions for others. If this is what interests you <BR>(helping those in spirit to <BR>> pass messages along), then seek to make connections with people in <BR>the physical who are <BR>> openly and willingly on board your assistance. <BR>> <BR>> Margaret<BR>> <BR>> >>>Margaret and other colleagues on this forum, if a proven <BR>process can be initiated, the <BR>> information captured very clearly, and not faint, and it has to be <BR>clear that anyone <BR>> listening will hear the words, and if the spirit can confirm the <BR>info we have before
 them to <BR>> be accurate, and if the spirit can assure us that their loved one <BR>will not be offended, then <BR>> would it be ok for us to proceed? And why not? <<<<BR>> <BR>> --- In <A href="mailto:EVP-ITC%40yahoogroups.com">EVP-ITC@yahoogroups<WBR>.com</A>, Michael Edwards <f1cracker75@<WBR>> <BR>wrote:<BR>> ><BR>> > Thanks Margaret.<BR>> > <BR>> > If your vocation is a psychic in which patrons pay a known fee <BR>up front, and this <BR>> physcic uses the box as an additional tool to get that icing on <BR>the cake, the actual voice, <BR>> that I have no issues with. In every field there are crooks, so we <BR>can at best hope we are <BR>> with a kind person when the meeting takes place.<BR>> > <BR>> > But if a person just goes out and buys a radio shack hack, and <BR>this is not their field, <BR>> and they do get a message, if these individuals try and make money <BR>off the recipient of
 <BR>> the message, that would in my book be terrible. The reason is that <BR>the spirit contacted <BR>> the living to get help, and now that living person is ripping off <BR>their loved one for cash <BR>> before they deliver the goods. If a spirit asks for help, we <BR>should do it for free.<BR>> > <BR>> > I write procedures for my company, and have been outlining a <BR>process to test with a <BR>> willing spirit who wants to make contact with their loved one. <BR>> > <BR>> > So what would I or any of us need to make contact? Meaning if <BR>a spirit gave me "John <BR>> Smith" of Norfolk, VA, confirmation would be a night mare at best. <BR>I would need to <BR>> perhaps lay out a list of actuall addresses in that city and state <BR>to have the spirit tell me <BR>> which one on my desk, on my list is the correct oerson, and then <BR>as you say how would <BR>> this person respond to my call about my research and that a voice
 <BR>gave me their name and <BR>> I have a recorded message for them? <BR>> > <BR>> > Margaret and other colleagues on this forum, if a proven <BR>process can be initiated, the <BR>> information captured very clearly, and not faint, and it has to be <BR>clear that anyone <BR>> listening will hear the words, and if the spirit can confirm the <BR>info we have before them to <BR>> be accurate, and if the spirit can assure us that their loved one <BR>will not be offended, then <BR>> would it be ok for us to proceed? And why not?<BR>> > <BR>> > My plan is to set up a spirit profile along with on same page <BR>the loved one's profile. But <BR>> before I actually make contact, I want to be sure that who i am <BR>contacting is the real deal, <BR>> and that they will not be offended. I have been laying out canned <BR>calls, for example, <BR>> "Hello, my name is xyz, and I am engaged in xxx research involving <BR>EVP. (Explain what
 <BR>> that is), and a voice picked up on my recording gave me your name, <BR>and go from there. <BR>> > <BR>> > Thinking out loud here, I would think that the sprit would <BR>know if their loved one <BR>> would be in acceptance to me contacting them. <BR>> > <BR>> > I am documenting everything step by step, and I do plan to <BR>attempt contact if I have <BR>> the right info. I am thinking that I need to tweak my profile to <BR>get confirmation on <BR>> whether the loved one would be in acceptance of me delivering the <BR>message.<BR>> > <BR>> > If there are any of you that have actually contacted a loved <BR>one you did not know that a <BR>> spirit asked you to contact, please advise how you handled the <BR>first call.<BR>> > <BR>> > I know it may take me days, weeks, months and even perhaps <BR>years to get enough info <BR>> on one profile to make contact, but I really want to do this and I <BR>want to
 perfect it, so <BR>> others can become messengers for the deceased. <BR>> > <BR>> > itcdeadpeople <ITCdeadpeople@<WBR>> wrote:<BR>> > Hi Michael. I have had the honor many times of either <BR>receiving messages for <BR>> someone <BR>> > from their loved one and passing them on (to people I know) or <BR>in helping people learn <BR>> to <BR>> > record for and receive their own messages. Along with research <BR>in trying to improve <BR>> > communication with the other side, this is my primary work with <BR>EVP... helping others <BR>> who <BR>> > are grieving make contact with their loved ones. I do not charge <BR>for this.<BR>> > <BR>> > I think to charge, or attempt to charge, anyone for a service <BR>(spiritual or otherwise) on <BR>> the <BR>> > backend is slimy. However, if there is an agreement in advance <BR>about fees and services, <BR>> > then that is up to the consenting parties.
 People in all types <BR>of fields get paid for their <BR>> > time, regardless of the service being offered. If the fee is <BR>clear, the service being offered <BR>> > legitimate, so be it. As long as people aren't being scammed. <BR>grrrr...... I don't like to see <BR>> > people taken advantage of in any field of service (as one <BR>crooked auto mechanic tried to <BR>> > do recently with my mother.) Double grrrrrr.....<WBR>... <BR>> > <BR>> > As for figuring out who a message belongs to? I think we have to <BR>be very cautious in <BR>> > coming forward with content in recordings that were not <BR>requested by the living loved <BR>> one <BR>> > of the person in spirit. It's sort of like the doctor's creed to <BR>first do no harm. I feel unless <BR>> > you know someone well enough to be fairly certain that your <BR>doing so would not <BR>> > traumatize them, you have to err on the side of caution and not <BR>say
 anything. <BR>> > <BR>> > For instance, there are some people who, due to their religious <BR>beliefs, could feel that <BR>> you <BR>> > are being fooled by a demon or some other evil and that your <BR>saying you are in a touch <BR>> > with a loved one of theirs is not only not true, but cruel of <BR>you to claim so. Even worse, <BR>> > would be those who actually do believe you have heard from their <BR>loved one, but take <BR>> that <BR>> > to mean they are not in 'Heaven' (as some believe those in <BR>Heaven do not have the <BR>> ability <BR>> > to communicate here.) There's all kinds of beliefs which differ <BR>from our reality that our <BR>> > loved ones can be exactly where they are supposed to be, in a <BR>good place, and still talk <BR>> to <BR>> > us via EVP. We have to make sure that there is a similarity in <BR>world views.<BR>> > <BR>> > In regard to mediumship: Even as a experienced
 EVPer, and having <BR>made connections <BR>> with <BR>> > my own loved ones, I still benefited from my sitting for an hour <BR>with a medium.
